question: How does MoonPay structure its data collection across different services?
contexts:
How does MoonPay collect my personal information? The MoonPay entity you contract with decides how your personal information is processed in relation to
the Services provided to you (typically referred to as a “data controller”). MoonPay collects your personal information when you: Anonymized and aggregated data
In addition to the categories of personal information described above, MoonPay will also process
anonymized information and data that is not processed by reference to a specific individual. Types of
data we may anonymize include transaction data, click-stream data, performance metrics and fraud
answer:
Main Answer:
MoonPay's data collection is structured based on the specific services provided and the nature of the user's interaction. The data collection process is initiated when users engage with MoonPay's services, and the type of information gathered varies depending on the context.

Key Points:
• MoonPay's data collection is service-specific, tailored to the user's interaction with their platform.
• Personal information is collected when users engage with MoonPay's services, such as during transactions or interactions requiring personal data.
• Anonymized data, including transaction details, click-stream data, performance metrics, and fraud-related information, is also processed by MoonPay.
• The MoonPay entity acting as the data controller determines how personal information is processed, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.

GDPR References:
Article 4 - Definitions
Article 26 - Joint Controllers
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
MoonPay implements a comprehensive data collection framework that spans across their Ramps Services, NFT Services, and other cryptocurrency offerings. Their approach divides collection into three main channels: direct user provision, automated collection, and third-party sources. Each collection method is tied to specific service requirements and regulatory obligations, with clear documentation of purpose and necessity. The system implements different collection protocols based on service type and jurisdiction, with particular attention to financial data requirements. Their framework maintains specific procedures for each data category, ensuring appropriate collection limits while meeting operational needs.

Key Points:
• Structured data collection methods aligned with specific service requirements
• Purpose-specific collection protocols for different cryptocurrency services
• Clear documentation of necessity and regulatory requirements
• Separate procedures for handling sensitive financial information

GDPR Reference: Article 5(1)(b) - Purpose limitation

question: How does MoonPay manage international data transfers for its cryptocurrency services?
contexts:
MoonPay is an international business with operations in countries including the UK, the EU and the US.
This means we may transfer to locations outside of your country. When we transfer your personal
information to another country, we will ensure that any transfer of your personal information is How does MoonPay collect my personal information? The MoonPay entity you contract with decides how your personal information is processed in relation to
the Services provided to you (typically referred to as a “data controller”). MoonPay operates internationally through different entities (together “MoonPay”, “we”, “us”, “our”) in
order to provide Services to our customers. The following table describes which entity (or entities) you
answer:
Main Answer:
MoonPay, as an international business, manages international data transfers for its cryptocurrency services by ensuring that any transfer of personal information across borders is done securely and in compliance with data protection regulations. The specific MoonPay entity you contract with acts as the data controller, determining the processing of personal data related to the services provided.

Key Points:
• MoonPay operates through various entities worldwide, collectively referred to as "MoonPay," to offer services to its global customer base.
• The data controller role is assigned to the MoonPay entity with which the user contracts, allowing it to make decisions regarding personal data processing.
• When transferring personal information internationally, MoonPay ensures compliance with data protection laws, including the GDPR, to safeguard user data.
• A table within the privacy policy details the specific MoonPay entities responsible for data processing, providing transparency to users.

GDPR References:
Article 44 - Transfers Subject to Appropriate Safeguards
Article 45 - Transfers on the Basis of an Adequacy Decision
Article 46 - Transfers Subject to Appropriate Safeguards
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
MoonPay implements a sophisticated cross-border data transfer framework through its international network of entities in the UK, EU, US, and other regions. Their approach combines entity-specific protocols with comprehensive safeguards designed for cryptocurrency transactions. For transfers out of the UK and EEA, they employ adequacy decisions and model contractual clauses, supplemented by specialized measures for different types of financial data flows. The system maintains separate protocols for verification data, transaction information, and support interactions, with continuous monitoring across all operational entities. Their framework ensures consistent protection standards while adapting to local requirements, with particular attention to the technical aspects of blockchain-based services and cross-jurisdictional compliance needs.

Key Points:
• Uses jurisdiction-specific transfer protocols for different operating entities with enhanced crypto safeguards
• Implements UK/EEA approved safeguards including model clauses and supplementary measures
• Maintains separate documentation for different transfer types and monitoring systems
• Ensures consistent protection standards across global operations

GDPR Reference: Article 46 - Transfers subject to appropriate safeguards

answer:
Main Answer:
MoonPay, a global financial technology company, prioritizes the protection of user data by implementing robust security measures and adhering to GDPR principles. They collect personal information when users engage in specific activities on their platform, such as creating an account, making a purchase, or contacting customer support.

Key Points:
• MoonPay's security measures include safeguards for customer files based on information sensitivity, restricted access controls, and limited physical access to authorized employees.
• Personal information is collected when users perform specific actions, such as account creation, purchases, or customer support interactions.
• The company emphasizes the necessity of processing personal data for providing services, resolving issues, and ensuring uninterrupted user experiences.
• Transparency is maintained through a detailed privacy policy, keeping users informed about data collection practices and their rights.

GDPR References:
Article 5 - Principles relating to processing of personal data
Article 6 - Lawfulness of processing
Article 12 - Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
MoonPay implements specific GDPR compliance measures for blockchain operations: 1) Data minimization by storing personal data off-chain, 2) Clear documentation of processing purposes for on-chain data, 3) Implementation of data subject rights through off-chain deletion and identity unlinking. Their approach includes transparent communication about technical limitations of blockchain modification and provides alternative compliance measures for user rights. The system maintains clear procedures for responding to data subject requests within blockchain constraints.

Key Points:
• Off-chain personal data storage
• Documented processing limitations
• Clear data subject rights procedures
• Alternative compliance measures

GDPR Reference: Article 17 - Right to erasure

answer:
Main Answer:
MoonPay has regulatory compliance requirements primarily to adhere to anti-money laundering and security laws. These regulations mandate the processing of personal information to ensure the prevention of financial crimes and the protection of user data.

Key Points:
• MoonPay's compliance is essential to verify user identities, especially when linking bank accounts, as it helps mitigate risks and detect potential fraudulent activities.
• The company may collaborate with service providers and financial institutions to process payments and manage user data securely.
• Personal information is collected to establish user accounts, provide services, and meet legal obligations, ensuring a secure and compliant platform.
• MoonPay's contracts with service providers and advisors ensure that user information is handled securely and only for the intended purposes.

GDPR References:
Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing
Article 9 - Processing of Special Categories of Personal Data
Article 22 - Automated Individual Decision-making, including Profiling
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
MoonPay operates under multiple regulatory frameworks as a financial service provider handling cryptocurrency transactions. Their operations require adherence to specific AML regulations, know-your-customer requirements, and financial reporting obligations. The system maintains compliance with distinct requirements for each operating jurisdiction. Their approach implements specific measures for different regulatory regimes while ensuring consistent standards across operations.

Key Points:
• Specific regulatory obligations
• Distinct compliance requirements
• Jurisdictional variations
• Required operational measures

GDPR Reference: Article 6(1)(c) - Legal obligation
